Row.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Arts[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, and reduces [ICON_CULTURE] Boredom by 25%.
Investing production in art is a good way to boost your Civilization's cutural output, either to grab that next policy or to stave off a Tourism victory. Also reduces boredom.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Defense[ENDCOLOR] boosts City [ICON_STRENGTH] Defense and increases Hit Point recovery by 10% of the City's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Investing production in defense is a last-ditch method to stave off your city's conquest by a foreign power.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Farming[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_FOOD] Food, and reduces [ICON_FOOD] and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Distress by 25%.

Investing production in farming is a good way to boost your City's growth, which can be useful if you have more productive tiles than Citizens, or you want to work more Specialists in the long run. Also reduces distress.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Propaganda[ENDCOLOR] converts 15% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires the Socialist Realism Tenet to be unlocked.

{TXT_KEY_PROCESS_TOURISM_HELP}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Investing production in propaganda is a good way to boost your City's influence in the world, which can be useful if you are currently in a revolutionary wave, or if you want to force other Civilizations to experience one.
Contribute this city's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards the Treasure Fleet project. Cost goes up based on the number of players in the game, and the current Era.
Contribute this city's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards the Global Wargames project. Cost goes up based on the number of players in the game, and the current Era.
Contribute this city's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards the United Nations project. Cost goes up based on the number of players in the game, and the current Era.
